snippet: As the president begins his second term, he holds the approval of 51 percent of Americans, according to a poll by The New York Times and CBS News.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll shows that Pres Obama, as he begins his second term, holds approval of 51 percent of Americans; analysis of numbers finds that most Democrats approve of how he is handling his job, while most Republicans do not.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN
byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As the president begins his second term, he holds the approval of 51 percent of Americans, according to a poll by The New York Times and CBS News.

headline.seo: Entering 2nd Term, Obama Has 51 Percent Approval Rating
headline.main: Poll Finds Most Back Obama, With a Split on Party Lines
headline.print_headline: Poll Finds Most Back Obama, With a Split On Party Lines
